title: "How can respiratory and physical exercises improve your energy and self-control?"
first_phrase: In the last section of this text, the focus is on physical exercises, particularly those that help improve breathing, accelerate circulation, and increase energy levels without causing fatigue. The text presents two exercises, Exercise 29 and Exercise 30, that can be practiced to achieve these results. These exercises are informed by the belief that taking care of our physique is necessary to guard our mental forces and avoid frittering them away. The text also emphasizes the importance of breathing in augmenting our energy and magnetism and increasing self-control.
content: You must first exhale from the lungs as much air as you can, whereafter you slowly inhale it through the nose, making sure to keep the mouth closed. At that stage, draw in the greatest possible amount of air, and follow that by holding the breath as you slowly count up to five. You finally draw out the air from the mouth, whereupon you repeat the exercise after a few secondsâ€™ break. You should strive to repeat it three or four times in succession, and try to hold your breath for progressively longer periods as you go through the exercise again. After three or four mornings during which you practice it, this exercise might then be shelved aside in favour of carrying out the following one. Exercise 30 Put yourselves in the abovementioned position; exhale as much as air as you can from the lungs and, as you inhale, lift up your arms once more, horizontally, forcing yourselves to keep them as stiff as possible. You should ensure to spend as much time in forming a right angle with your arms and the rest of your body as it is necessary for you to inject air into the lungs.
last_phrase: Incorporating these breathing exercises into your daily routine can have numerous health benefits, including increased lung capacity and a reduction in stress levels. Remember to start slowly and aim to gradually increase the length of time you hold your breath and the number of repetitions you do. With consistent practice, you can improve your overall well-being and optimize your mental and physical performance.
